history.content: don't think so... they said only graduate eecs courses that don't count for your ugrad. besides 5th year ms has to be upper div level breadth (not in eecs dept)

children.subject:
According to the Advisor, classes used to fulfill any undergraduate requirement cannot be used for the 5th yr.

Graduate staff don't monitor this page. If you have further questions, please email Michael at msun86@berkeley.edu.

Sorry should've written my question more carefully (updated). If I were to take any upper div breadth (e.g. ECON 101A), do you mean I wouldn't be able to use it for both the H/SS requirement and the M.S. breadth requirement?

history.content:
According to the Advisor, classes used to fulfill any undergraduate requirement cannot be used for the 5th yr.

Graduate staff don't monitor this page. If you have further questions, please email Michael at msun86@berkeley.edu.

For the 5th Year M.S., if I wanted to apply a breadth class taken during undergrad towards the M.S. breadth requirement, can that breadth class also be used to satisfy an undergrad degree requirement?

For example, if in my last undergrad semester I were to use ECON 101A to satisfy one of the six classes for the H/SS requirement for EECS, would I still be able to use ECON 101A towards the M.S. breadth requirement?
history.subject: Using undergrad breadth for 5th Year M.S.

history.content:
For the 5th Year M.S., if I wanted to apply a breadth class taken during undergrad towards the M.S. breadth requirement, can that breadth class also be used to satisfy any other undergrad degree requirement?

For example, if in my last undergrad semester I were to use ECON 101A to satisfy one of the six classes for the H/SS requirement for EECS, would I still be able to use ECON 101A towards the M.S. breadth requirement?
history.subject: Using undergrad breadth for 5th Year M.S.

history.content:
For the 5th Year M.S., if I wanted to apply a breadth class taken during undergrad towards the M.S. breadth requirement, can that breadth class not be used to satisfy any other undergrad degree requirement?

For example, if in my last undergrad semester I were to use ECON 1 to satisfy one of the six classes for the H/SS requirement for EECS, would I still be able to use ECON 1 towards the M.S. breadth requirement?
history.subject: Using undergrad breadth for 5th Year M.S.
